attributes.action: Contraceptive pill boxes to warn of major factors making the pill less effective
attributes.background: We would like legislation requiring manufacturers of contraceptive pills to clearly and prominently display a warning on the packaging showing the major factors in the pill being less effective. We would like a warning similar to that of a cigarette packet
attributes.additional_details: The side effects and health risk associated with all medication are contained on a large leaflet within the box. We would like to see the main factors causing the contraceptive pill to be less effective or ineffective printed in bold letters on the outside of the box. Many become pregnant each year believing that this will not happen as they have chosen to use the pill only to find that something else such as a bout of illness has stopped the pill working.

attributes.action: Make voting in general elections, and in future referendums compulsory.
attributes.background: Given the historical sacrifices made over any number of years by countless groups and individuals to enfranchise the public, the public should be required to vote, even if the choice is "none of the above". The lack of voting is a distinct failing or our democracy.

attributes.action: Increase the legal age limit in gambling shops to 25
attributes.background: Gambling is like crack cocaine addiction and i have been gambling from 18 and now im 21 turning 22 it has affected my mental health and has ruined my life at a young age so i say that the goverment should put a new age limit on gambling and help people stuck in this addiction
attributes.additional_details: Gambling has ruined my life and im only 21 turning 22 in april the goverment should be strict and look into this matter to stop allowing businesses to create more gambling stations in poor communities and instead build something resourceful for the people in need

attributes.action: Make the speed limits for larger vans the same as cars.
attributes.background: Transit sized vans are restricted to 50mph on single carriageways which anyone that drives one knows is not always a good thing. More time in your van means less work can be done.  Also it seems no one wants to be stuck behind a van at 50mph.  Reckless overtaking of vans is a common occurrence.
attributes.additional_details: Bringing the speed limit in line with cars would be a good thing and could possibly cause less accidents.  Vans are as safe as a lot of cars nowadays.

attributes.action: Change disabled parking signs to a D for disabled not a wheelchair
attributes.background: Disabled parking has a stigma attached you have to be in a wheel chair to use them but over 500000 people in the country how other disability where than don't need a wheel chair and are looked at as they should not park in the disabled  bays which is wrong

attributes.action: Limit the amount private parking enforcement companies can charge.
attributes.background: Many carparks are monitored by private parking enforcement companies. It is logical to ensure people obey parking rules but they often apply massive fines of £100 for minor parking violations. For many people such high fines cause financial difficulties, this is too high  for minor infractions.
attributes.additional_details: It is of course right to ensure people use carparks fairly and obey the rules. However it is totally unfair that a charge of £100 can be applied for say an overstay of just a few minutes.  For sites where people pay to park I think the limit should be £50 or 5 times the amount of underpayment, whichever is the lower.

attributes.action: Ban smacking children in the UK
attributes.background: Britain is now one of just four countries in Europe where smacking remains a legal way of disciplining children. Many studies have demonstrated that smacking has no long-term positive impact on children.  Please sign this petition to defend the basic human rights of our children.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many other, more effective, ways to discipline children that do not involve inflicting physical harm on them. 

Smacking should not be regarded as merely a form of discipline; it is assault and it must not be tolerated in this day and age. It is unacceptable that assaulted adults can go to the police, but assaulted children have no form of recourse.

attributes.action: Implement psychological well-being into the National Curriculum
attributes.background: A childs' development is fundamental for their continued success and well-being in later adult life. Schools should have a statutory responsibility to integrate psychological well-being education and support through integrating emotional coping and resilience strategies into the National Curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 4 people will experience a Mental Health issue in their lifetime. With Mental health being one of the main causes of the overall disease burden worldwide, and depression being the second largest cause of disability.

Educational establishments provide opportunity for students to develop academic, vocational, interpersonal and employability skills, yet fundamental psychological skills (i.e. coping, stress management) are very rarely discussed, let alone taught, understood or integrated.

attributes.action: Ensure every local government has homeless shelters and support workers for free
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We are trying to help homeless people by making it legal for all councils to have homeless shelters that are available 24/7. We also want to see an increase in funding for support workers who offer valuable advice.

attributes.action: Allow hospital A&E to refer people to minor injuries units if not an emergancy
attributes.background: Recently several minor injuries units in my local area were closed to staff A&E for patients that likely did not have life threatening injuries. Allow A&E departments to refuse treatment for non-emergency patients so they can focus more on saving the lives of those that need them.

attributes.action: Enforce deadlines upon car insurance companies for the completion of claims
attributes.background: A person involved in an accident & not at fault, can wait months if the other side ignore their insurance company and don't respond, due to their being no deadline on a response from the other party. Insurance should have 28 days to investigate blame & escalate to a dispute process if no agreement

attributes.action: Make it compulsory in England for Air Gun Licensing.
attributes.background: I think it should be made compulsory to stop people going in public places, ie woods and shooting anything that moves.
attributes.additional_details: I have been out with my dog and experienced a youth pointing a gun at my dog. As a license holder myself i believe that any gun, ie air pistol or air rifle you should have to hold a license for as you do with any other gun to stop these type of guns falling into the wrong hands.

attributes.action: Stricter regulations for complaints handling, for communications providers
attributes.background: Phone companies and other providers are neglecting their duties to provide effective customer service for complaints handling. Too many times we as consumers are lied to and made false promises, because these companies can.
attributes.additional_details: It's time the government responded and did something to protect consumers from unfair practice and make complaints handling legislation stricter.

attributes.action: When referring to our Debt state what we owe not what % it is of something else.
attributes.background: Since 1947 our Debt increased from £25 bn to £1,547 bn but when compared to GDP it allows Gov to conceal from us their out of control spending and borrowing of more than £2 bn every week for 10 years. For more alarming facts about the way Gov run our Country see www.mrms.uk
attributes.additional_details: A debt is “a sum of money owed” and should be referred to as such. There is no logical reason why Government should compare our National Debt to GDP (or anything else) other than to keep the truth from us of their out of control spending and borrowing.

attributes.action: we need to follow the example of other countries and burn landfill for energy
attributes.background: Landfill is taking over a lot of land in the UK. We should follow by example and burn our rubbish for recycled energy

attributes.action: Allow railway season ticket holders to vote on operator's franchise renewal.
attributes.background: Commuters usually have no choice about using the train. They cannot strike or otherwise inconvenience the operator in order to force improvements. They have no influence and are therefore totally ignored by the operators. Only if we can directly affect the operators will they take any notice of us.
attributes.additional_details:
If enough season ticket holders vote against renewal then the existing franchise holder is banned from being considered at any price.  
The vote would be open only to those holding monthly or longer season tickets for at least 3 months of the year. 
A majority of at least 60% (to be agreed) would be needed to remove the existing operator from consideration.

attributes.action: Hold A Referendum on whether to accept Freedom of Movement post Brexit.
attributes.background: The public voted to leave the EU. But they did this for a number of reasons, and it should not be assumed this was a direct rejection to the freedom of movement. Negotiations should not be based on the assumption that the UK public disagree with the four key principles, and a vote should be held.
attributes.additional_details:
The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) itself concluded that “The vast majority of people who voted to leave the European Union did so because they believe it is best for Britain and not because they are intolerant of others.” 
The government should acknowledge the identification of this fact, and the public disapproval of hate crime and xenophobia since the vote, and as such offer the opportunity for the freedom of movement to be decided on.

attributes.action: Make inappropriate/unwanted sexual pictures fall under the indecent exposure law
attributes.background:
Most women are subjected to unwanted sexual/inappropriate pictures from men usually of their penis on most social networking sites or phone apps
I feel this should fall under the indecent exposure laws

attributes.action: Make all tax on income, business rates and revenue fair and consistent
attributes.background: Companies making billions in revenue from operating in the UK can take advantage of tax loopholes, government deals and reduced tax rates, yet the burden of the tax bill is being paid by the average employee being taxed on a basic rate of 20% and national insurance at 13.8%. PAYE needs to be fairer.
attributes.additional_details:
The government will reduce the amount of corporation tax paid by businesses to 17% by 2020, yet if you are an employee on a standard PAYE system you're taxed at a basic rate of 20% which can increase up to 45%. How is this right?

You can not take advantage of these rates, tax is taken automatically from your salary every month. The government continues to give tax breaks to the people that own these companies, not the employees that are paying a disproportionate tax rate to their employers.

attributes.action: Grant legal rights of bodily liberty/integrity to apes, dolphins & elephants.
attributes.background: International scientific studies on genetics, intelligence, emotions and the social lives of these animals have proven to shown these animals are self-aware, autonomous beings.

attributes.action: Reduce Vat on Post from outside the UK.
attributes.background: It is quite absurd that an item costing £19.00 ($22.00 US) should then incur a £14 odd vat and handling charge. The handling charge of £8 is placed by the Royal Mail regardless of size weight or cost of item, and is added for anything with VAT to be paid.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the Vat Charges on small items are hardly worth the cost of auditing and tracking the payments, it would probably be more cost effective to have a slightly higher cut off, this will also have the effect of reducing the resentment the British public have in paying the extraordinary large charge to the Royal Mail for low cost items.

attributes.action: Government stop using JAM to describe those on the  breadline and apologise
attributes.background: This group of people struggle to make ends meet they use food banks and often go without. This terminology is a deliberate attempt to disguise this as a sweet little group, rather than those forced to use food banks or go hungry. It is wordplay at it's most disgusting stop and apologise.

attributes.action: Include Religious Studies as a Humanities subject in the English Baccalaureate.
attributes.background: The exclusion of RS from the EBacc is leading to a reduction in the overall understanding of religion in the UK, and suggests that RS is an unimportant subject. In a world increasingly defined by a lack of understanding of religious belief, this is a clear mistake by the Government.

attributes.action: Introduce a flat rate of income tax of 15% and increase the threshold to £15,000
attributes.background: Exclude single incomes of less than £15,000 from income tax and National Insurance as these people cannot afford to be taxed. In addition, introduce a flat rate of income tax of 15% to ensure middle and high earners get to keep more of their hard earned money.
attributes.additional_details: The current levels of income tax are too high at 20% and 40%, dependent on income. A staggered tax system acts as a disincentive to earn more. If people had more money through reduced taxation, standard of living would increase and VAT to the government would increase as people invest in more luxuries. Welfare cuts as well as significant cuts in foreign aid spending could potentially cover the reduction in tax revenue.

attributes.action: Change the law and policy on the use of fireworks in the UK.
attributes.background: Following a recent petition calling for a ban and the official response, to further obtain public opinion on the misuse of fireworks. Government to fund research into the impact on human and animal health and well being to be the primary aim of the research.

attributes.action: Make Gift Aid easier for donors and recipients with a single, simple mechanism
attributes.background: The mechanism to provide Gift Aid to a charity is too complex, takes too much effort and fails too often.  It is almost like the Government does not want to provide Gift Aid. Everyone would benefit is this were simpler, and more successful with a single, easy, standard mechanism.
attributes.additional_details:
Often people are put off donating because of Gift Aid complexities, Gift Aid fails or people get overburdened by different Gift Aid cards etc. Charities waste money dealing with complex Gift Aid processes.

Ideally, there would be a single, simple mechanism to provide Gift Aid. This could be a single card type mechanism provided by Charities (recognised by Government and Charities). Alternatively, a unique identifier (eg a ‘Gift Aid’ number or possibly the NI number) would be sufficient.

attributes.action: Clamp down on the tax loop holes for contractors and limited companies.
attributes.background: Certain contractors are avoiding tax by paying corporation tax at 20pc and taking a modest wage plus dividends from the company, they save on income tax and National Insurance contributions. Some are also able to keep child benefits because their “wage” is under the threshold.
attributes.additional_details: Throughout the course of my career I have seen a major shift in work employment, from employees moving from being permanent PAYE to self employed or contracting predominantly for tax benefits. If we continue down this path of legal tax avoidance, soon there will be nobody permanently employed, declaring a full salary and paying their tax in relation to their actual earnings.  Some individuals are actually qualifying themselves for child support by declaring low salaries. This is morally wrong.

attributes.action: Simplify the legal process of buying and selling a home
attributes.background: Buying and selling a home in the U.K. is an overly complicated, slow, and frustrating process. Introduce a single body to deal with 'searches' (Land Registry?), create an online system to track progress and facilitate communication, and reduce the ability of parties to make changes prior to exchange
attributes.additional_details: The current system has barely changed in decades. Solicitors still communicate via post, creating huge delays waiting for various documents to be passed between parties. Too many separate entities need to be consulted, often to confirm obvious or know facts. The existing system provides no incentive to reform the process as it generates significant 'easy money' for solicitors, estate agents and others, with buyers and sellers lacking the knowledge to challenge the process.

attributes.action: Introduce a living will the right to die if diagnose of Alzheimer or dementia
attributes.background:
I am 75 years of age and  I am in good health and sound of mind. I don't want to end my days where I don't know family and friends and I can't do anything for myself ie speak, wash, walk or feed myself. So
 I therefore want the right to die when two doctors say that I have no quality of life
attributes.additional_details:
I have friends and relatives that have either Alzheimer's or dementia. They don't know anybody, they can't feed themselves or wash or go the toilet and some can't even speak.They are just waiting to die, some of them have been like this for more than two years. In the early stages I was told by some of them that they wanted this option and die with dignity
there is no cure for these illnesses

attributes.action: Toughen Rules on online gambling & self exclusion in the UK
attributes.background: After going through a massive gambling problem myself I believe the UK is still failing to protect problem gamblers. I believe if you are self excluded from one company this should exclude you from all companies as there's way too many and you can just open another account.
attributes.additional_details: Also many companies although not all do not make it easy for you to be able to check if a particular site is owned by one you are already excluded from. and more than often if this happens the company is just taking your money and hiding behind daft T&CS. and not really helping the problem gambler. Also make it standard practice to have self exclusion buttons on uk gaming sites again to protect the player and so they can be instantly excluded.

attributes.action: Impose a life long ban for HGV drivers caught driving while using mobile device
attributes.background: I suggest that any HGV driver caught driving whilst using a mobile device, should be issued a instant life long ban. In view of the amount of accidents and deaths caused by this. If applicable an additional fine to the registered keeper of £5000.00 should be issued.
attributes.additional_details: I suggest that any HGV driver caught driving whilst using a mobile device, should be issued a instant life long ban. In view of the amount of accidents and deaths caused by this. If applicable an additional fine to the registered keeper of £5000.00 should be issued. UK courts should also have the power to ban foreign drivers to the UK upon presentation of their licences at UK ports.

attributes.action: Debate why restaurants have so few allergy free options and why more isn't done
attributes.background: In many restaurants there's often only one or two gluten free options on a menu when could be more. For instance if chips were fried GF, as they would otherwise be GF. Instead often the same oil used for frying breadcrumb/batter based food to save money. There are other instances of this as well.
attributes.additional_details: It's reported 7% of U.K. population have a gluten allergy or intolerance, this affecting a few million people. There are a few restaurants that do make the effort and why not many more. For instance some restaurants use separate oil but many don't. This would very easily widen the choice when eating out with family and friends making it a much more enjoyable experience, which otherwise can be quite off-putting. This should also be debated on other allergies and what could be done to help.

attributes.action: Minimum 3 month driving ban and £1k fine if caught using a mobile phone driving.
attributes.background: Using a hand held mobile phone while driving can have the same consequences as drink driving. Drivers caught not using hands free devices should be subject to a minimum 3 month driving ban and a minimum £1000 fine. The only way we can try and stop this is by imposing tougher laws.

attributes.action: Stop the addictive drug Codeine being sold as an over the counter medicine.
attributes.background:
Many people are finding themselves taking Codeine on a regular basis through over the counter pain killers and cough medicine even when symptoms have stopped.
Codeine is an Opiate drug.
Despite fairly recent warnings on the packets and from sales assistants, people are becoming addicted.
attributes.additional_details:
Information on Codeine addiction and where to get help can be found online.
Many people are using these drugs to relax, get to sleep etc and becoming dependant.
This is a serious problem and health issue with a suprising amount of people finding themselves addicted and sales of these drugs are increasing.
Making these drugs prescription only and providing help for people who have become addicted would be a simple solution to the problem, manufacturers are the only ones benefitting from it.

attributes.action: The mandatory installation of an automatic braking system in all lorries
attributes.background: Due to the recent tragic accidental killing of a family of four people by a lorry with a distracted driver, I petition that all lorries be fitted with an mandatory automatic braking system that would come into force if the driver were incapacitated or distracted.

attributes.action: Pass a law so that EU roaming charges are abolished despite the Brexit vote
attributes.background: The EU has introduce a law to ban roaming charges across the union. However, as UK is leaving those laws won't apply for UK networks and charges will go up. One way is to make a law to stop networks charging for EU roaming. This law could be reciprocal to make negotiations easier.
attributes.additional_details: This law will work by making mobile networks abolish roaming charges or face fines if they fail to do so. This will protect holidaymakers from shock bills. You could also introduce a reciprocal law for EU holidaymakers coming to the UK. This means that EU mobile networks can't charge for roaming in he UK. This will make negotiations easier as it will benefit EU citizens as well.

attributes.action: To allow our Daughter in Law from China to come to UK to meet us
attributes.background:
Our son has been married for four and half years and had to sell up here in the uk to be with his wife as she had two applications turned down once because they did not believe they were married second that she would not return to China.
We are now in our late 80s and would like to meet her soon

attributes.action: Establish protocols for all new born babies with law bound practises.
attributes.background: Our youngest daughter was born with hyperextension in her right knee. The midwife refused to touch her and had no knowledge or experience of this condition. The physio didn't have experience, the health visitors ignored us when milestones were missed. How many other children were not being supported
attributes.additional_details:
After lots of nagging and persuasion we got the referrals we needed. At almost two she was finally getting the level of care she needed. The new physio told us that children as old as four were unable to walk- this lead us to question what happened to them?
The physio gave us the idea of the protocol. There are key documents supporting children with special educational needs and disabilities but they are no good without knowledge and guidelines for less well known conditions. MAKE PROTOCOLS LAW

attributes.action: Make the DWP provide email contact details so deaf people can get in touch too.
attributes.background: Access to work are making it extremely difficult to get back into work and off benefits, leaving people without money during training. I want to make a complaint but on their website they only list telephone numbers. This is useless to a deaf person like myself.
attributes.additional_details:
In order to get access to work help for an interpreter during training, ESA must be cancelled. Training is 3 hours a week on minimum wage before the actual job starts, leaving people with no money. More discrimination here because if an interpreter was not required, a person can claim ESA during training as they are not working enough hours per week to come off it. 

I want to make an official complaint via email and receive a quick response but the DWP only provide telephone numbers.

attributes.action: Do not build an extra runway at any London airport. Increase efficiency.
attributes.background: Rather than spending millions on building a new runway we need to better use what airports we have and increase the speed and efficiency of public transport. If we are to meet global CO2 reduction targets this is of paramount importance. Air travel needs not be idolised.
attributes.additional_details: CO2 concentrations are increasing and this is causing global temperatures to rise. Rather than focusing on increased capacity for air travel, encouraging it, we need to better use the airports we have and link them with better (and greener) public transport. This is of paramount importance if we are serious about anthropogenic climate change and considering the Paris agreement. Perhaps we could create jobs in tree-planting, conservation and green energy instead?

attributes.action: Enshrine the UKRI's long-term mission and Haldane principle in Royal Charter
attributes.background: The Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 will dissolve UK Research Councils' Royal Charters and form a super-council, UK Research & Innovation (UKRI), to act strategically across disciplines. The UKRI must aim to fund research for the UK's long-term good, at arm's length from day-to-day politics.
attributes.additional_details: Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 [Bill No 004 of 2016-17]

attributes.action: Allow intended parents of surrogate children, to have legal right from birth,
attributes.background: When surrogates are used they have the legal right to keep that child even if they have no biological connection, I want intended parents to have legal right of the child from birth to give more people a chance to have a child without fear of it the surrogate keeping them.

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find £8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over £10 for 1 item.

attributes.action: Create a standard VED for all vehicles (with a fixed motor/engine) in the UK.
attributes.background: With vehicle excise duty (VED) rising year after year due to emissions, this is unfair and discriminating to large vehicle owners and being detrimental to the haulage industry, especially when hybrid and electric vehicle are exempt from VED. While the road quality in the UK is in decline.
attributes.additional_details: When VED was first introduced 1920 it was original create to help maintain the road structure of the UK up to 1937, due to weight of the vehicle using it. After 1937 it was change to a general tax, then was changed to emissions from 2001. The problem with this is some hybrid/electric vehicle weigh more than fuel vehicles, due to their components (batteries). Creating a greater stress on the road surface then a fuel vehicle. My proposal is to charge £1 for every 10kg the vehicle weighs.

attributes.action: Allow EU citizens resident in the UK on 23 June 2016 to cast a retroactive vote.
attributes.background: By denying EU citizens a vote, the Government goes contrary to the UN's declaration of human rights (Article 21): ”The will of the people shall be the basis of the authority of government; this will shall be expressed in periodic and genuine elections which shall be by universal and equal suffrage"
attributes.additional_details: EU citizens deserve a vote, just like citizens of the commonwealth (such as Australia, Canada, New Zealand, Pakistan, India, Bangladesh, Malta, Cyprus etc.) who were resident in the UK were given a vote.

attributes.action: Pay student veterinary nurses whilst on their years placement.
attributes.background: By not paying student veterinary nurses on their year placement this profession is discriminating against less wealthy individuals from pursuing this career. Student finance is not enough to cover the cost of living. It is essentially slave labour to expect any one to work for free for a year.
attributes.additional_details: Every student veterinary nurse at degree level is expected to undertake 2100 hours of full time work placement with out any pay. This expectation is outrageous. Student finance does not cover the cost of living day to day, childcare and the cost of running a car. A diploma level student veterinary nurse gets a wage, however a degree level veterinary nurse doesn't. This is simply slave labour and a way for veterinary practices to have full time staff members at no cost to themselves.

attributes.action: Do not criminalise parents for failing to get their children to school on time.
attributes.background:
We all know how unreliable public transport is and things go wrong on the roads, slowing down traffic.

Charging poor / low income parents £60 for not getting a child to school on time will ruin a lot of families and give them a criminal record.

Are they going to criminalise bus companies too?
attributes.additional_details: Of course the UK want to show the world that we are serious about education, but let the evolutionary breakthroughs that are pooring out of our top universities be a testament to that... Don't criminalise good, law abiding, hard working people - It's completely bonkers!

attributes.action: The British blue passport should be reintroduced in 2019
attributes.background: The iconic British blue passport was scrapped in 1988 starting the homogenisation of EU countries with the clear aim of moving towards a United States of Europe and centralisation of power in Brussels. The renewal of contract in 2019 affords an opportunity to reintroduce the classic Blue passport
attributes.additional_details: The traditional British blue passport should be reintroduced in 2019 when the current contract is renewed. The change in colour will be a nil cost option and can be incorporated into the security feature updates.

attributes.action: 50p a month from UK tax payers to get put in a fund for life saving treatment
attributes.background: It should be a requirement of the government to take 50p a month from every tax payer and start a fund for life saving treatment that is not available in the UK. No one should have to try to raise money to save their child's/family members life, it should be readily available as and when it's needed
attributes.additional_details: Charliesfight.org has made me realise no parent should have to try raise money to save their child's life. Giving a working class family one month to raise £1.2million or they switch of their babies machine is heartbreaking. With a readily available fund curtesy of the UK tax payer cases like Charlie's could be funded and sent to America for the life saving treatment needed. 50p a month from every UK tax payer would raise millions of pounds and save lives whilst costing the government nothing.

attributes.action: Allow a Dictionary in the new Modern Foreign Language exams
attributes.background: In the previous MFL exams, students were allowed access to a dictionary. This has now changed and we are no longer allowed any help from a Dictionary at all.
attributes.additional_details: The Exam Board is now expecting us to know every word in the exam. Unless fluent this is going to be impossible. The dictionary was available in the plan before the speaking assessment and for the writing but now it's not allowed at all. Where is the fairness in that? As a year 10 student I am still VERY reliable on the dictionary during lessons and I know I will fail, along with many others, because of this new rule. (Bearing in mind, the exam has stayed as difficult as it was)
